Title: TotalEnergies to withdraw capital for new projects in Russia
Description: TotalEnergies will continue its activities in Russia but will no longer provide capital for new projects in Russia, in response to Russia’s military aggression against Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass ships its maiden LNG cargo three weeks after receiving first ship at terminal
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG export plant in Louisiana has shipped its first commissioning cargo on the 147,000 m3 Yiannis LNG tanker, three weeks after the vessel arrived at the terminal for loading.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin LNG offtakers unfazed by Shell’s decision to exit the project
Description: LNG offtakers at the Sakhalin Energy-operated 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant on Russia’s Sakhalin Island expect LNG exports from the plant to continue without interruption despite Shell’s intention to divest its stake in Sakhalin Energy and exit from its other joint ventures with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom.
Author: CK

Title: One Russian LNG vessel diverted from the UK as it bars port access to Russia-connected ships
Description: Russia’s Sovcomflot-owned 172,600 m3 Christophe de Margerie ice-class LNG carrier has diverted away from the UK and is sailing to France’s 8 mtpa Montoir LNG receiving facility, following the UK’s decision to ban ships with Russian connections entry to its ports.
Author: CK

Title: UK bans ships with Russian associations from entering its ports
Description: The UK has blocked the entry of any vessels owned, operated or chartered by any person connected with Russia, as it prepares to impose further restrictive economic sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Shell to divest stake in Sakhalin LNG as it exits all joint ventures with Gazprom
Description: Shell intends to exit its joint ventures with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom, including the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant that delivers LNG to key LNG buyers in northeast Asia, in response to Russia’s military aggression in Ukraine.
Author: CK
